==== News ====

1. Further to the reshuffles at Canonical, Matt Asay joins Canonical as Chief operating officer.

<nowiki>[[http://www.ubuntu.com/news/matt-asay-coo-canonical|http://www.ubuntu.com/news/matt-asay-coo-canonical]]</nowiki>

2. Ars Technica:
Quote: “Canonical, the company behind the popular Ubuntu Linux distribution, revealed today that it has established a revenue sharing agreement with Yahoo.”

<nowiki>[[http://arstechnica.com/open-source/news/2010/01/ubuntus-default-search-engine-to-change-in-deal-with-yahoo.ars|http://arstechnica.com/open-source/news/2010/01/ubuntus-default-search-engine-to-change-in-deal-with-yahoo.ars]]</nowiki>

3. Is Canonical Becoming the new Microsoft?
<nowiki>[[http://www.theopensourcerer.com/2010/02/09/is-canonical-becoming-the-new-microsoft/|http://www.theopensourcerer.com/2010/02/09/is-canonical-becoming-the-new-microsoft/]]</nowiki>

4. OMGUbuntu.org
Ubuntu new s site: Canonical Music store hits Lucid; new icons and Ubuntu single sign-on.

<nowiki>[[http://omgubuntu.co.uk|http://omgubuntu.co.uk]]</nowiki>

5. Google Buzz. Google adds social networking.
Quote: “Go beyond status messages. Share updates, photos, videos, and more.
Start conversations about the things you find interesting.”

<nowiki>[[http://www.google.com/buzz?hl=en|Buzz overview]]</nowiki>
